article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10kXcf7 hentry entry story-marquee-standard

h2.a: Does Changing Your Profile Picture Actually Do Anything?

div.p: The reason why these avatars might actually make a difference has to do with the fact that at the end of the day, there’s a part of our brains that never quite made it out of high school.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YHe2ta hentry entry story-col-0

header.div: ALL THAT AND A BAG OF CHIPS

h2.a: If You're A Man, You Probably Don't Know You're Overweight

div.p: Men are more than twice as likely as women to underestimate their weight, finds a project with 300,000 participants

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14rFHzn hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: A DEADLY CASE OF BIEBER FEVER

h2.a: The Killing Of Justin Bieber

div.p: If not for one wrong turn, it might have been the most infamous celebrity crime of the century. Inside the plot to assassinate—and desecrate—the world's greatest teen idol.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-16kZEq0 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: North Korea Readying Rockets To Aim At U.S. Targets, State Media Says

div.p: North Korea's leader has approved a plan to prepare rockets to be on standby for firing at U.S. targets, including the U.S. mainland and military bases in the Pacific and in South Korea, state media reported.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YhNNHm hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: This Teenager’s Solution Could Clean Over 7 Million Tons Of Plastic From Ocean

div.p: Boyan Slat is an engineering student who is designing a concept for floating booms that would sift debris from the water.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WYXsBI hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: THERE ARE MANY APPS FOR THAT

h2.a: Your iPhone Kills Jobs

div.p: Smartphone apps have created a new digital underclass of low-paid and highly monitored workers. We're all to blame.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YDq97Q hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: How Ethical Hackers Are Using Cute Kittens To Trick Employees

div.p: Employees beware: Don't fall prey to a cat named Dr. Zaius.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10lGdtf hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Watch Google Maps Come To Life In Poignant Animation

div.p: A city, needing oil to thrive, leaves the map in search of black gold.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10ekbXW hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Why Doesn't The Moon Spin?

div.p: Look at the moon at any time and -- aside from the constantly changing phases that are caused by changing relative positions of the Earth, the moon and sun -- it does indeed show us the same face, constantly.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13BnCQ7 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: I Got A Taxpayer Subsidized Manicure At The Senate Salon

div.p: A trip to the underground barber shop where the world's greatest deliberative body gets its budget cuts.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10lIi8y hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The U.S. Army's Plans For WWII Bat Bombs

div.p: A few months before the Manhattan Project got underway, a dental surgeon named Lytle Adams came up with the idea to use bats—the nocturnal flying mammals—as part of the strategy.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YHoh0E hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: The Doll That Helped The Soviets Beat The U.S. To Space

div.p: Meet Ivan Ivanovich, the mannequin who beta tested space.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-170sRrB hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: NOW HE MUST PAY BAIL ON TOP OF BAG FEES

h2.a: Man Caught Smuggling More Than 10% Of An Entire Species Through An Airport

div.p: A Thai man was caught in an airport trying to pick up 54 ploughshare tortoises. There are perhaps 400 ploughshare tortoises in the wild.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11MQYd7 hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Three Science Words We Should Stop Using

div.p: How can we improve everyone’s ideas about the nature of science? I think there are three words that we shouldn’t use.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XJ5KuN hentry entry story-col-1

header.div: WARNINGS YOU DIDN'T KNOW YOU NEEDED

h2.a: The Rationale Behind Those 'Caution: Immigrant Crossing' Signs

div.p: These signs aren't actually as unnecessary and ridiculous as you think.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11STKtI hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: What Caused These 'Fairy Circles'?

div.p: The reddish barren spots, thousands of them, are called fairy circles, the name itself an invitation to try to solve the mystery of their origins.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Xf1bNH hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: How To Become A Teen Millionaire: Be An Insufferable Startup Brat

div.p: Nick D'Aloisio is 17 years old and lives with his parents in London. He has a girlfriend. He also just made $30 million—most of it in cash—by selling a dubious app to Yahoo!. Bully for Nick. But what Yahoo! doesn't realize is that they just hired a total pain in the ass.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10Uzb0W hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Who Invented The Mirror?

div.p: The silvered-glass mirrors found throughout the world today first got their start in Germany almost 200 years ago.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Xe59WM hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: How 1-Day Space Station Trips Work

div.p: For astronauts, chasing down and docking with the International Space Station has been a tedious two-day process on Russia's Soyuz spacecraft. A new technique cuts this to only six hours.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XjACWM hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: The, Endearing, Funny, And Disturbing Faces Of Ventriloquist Dummies

div.p: Although photographer Matthew Rolston has built a career on entertainment portraiture, advertising, and music videos, he suddenly found himself looking for a different outlet in 2009.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-XIrXZK hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Wal-Mart Trying To Get Customers To Deliver Packages To Online Buyers

div.p: Wal-Mart is considering a radical plan to have store customers deliver packages to online buyers, a new twist on speedier delivery services that the company hopes will enable it to better compete with Amazon.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14x3s9z hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Largest Computer Ever Built

div.p: All ages are characterized by madness; only a few have that madness captured in physical objects. Consider the largest computer ever built: the “Semi-Automatic Ground Environment” or SAGE system.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10UvKYa hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Newtown Documents Reveal Adam Lanza's Massive Arsenal And NRA Papers

div.p: New police documents were released today from the ongoing investigation into the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting in Newtown, Connecticut, including search records that reveal shooter Adam Lanza had amassed a gigantic home arsenal.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10cZL3b hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: How Memes Are Orchestrated By Companies For Profit

div.p: Experts said the “Harlem Shake” phenomenon was emergent behavior from the hive mind of the internet—accidental, ad hoc, uncoordinated: a “meme” that “went viral.” But this is untrue.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10U4zg5 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Craziest Conspiracy Theories On 'The Shining'

div.p: Here are the strangest theories in "The Shining" doc "Room 237", from the (fake) Apollo moon landing to the Holocaust.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10kQjdK hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: A Guide To Who's Hooked Up On 'Game Of Thrones'

div.p: The show sneaks in so many hookups between the gore and political intrigue that it can be difficult to keep track of dozens of characters’ various dalliances. So, to help our fellow fans, we’ve compiled a handy list of who’s hooked up with whom.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-11S7epA hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: The Ten Most Unbelievable Military Testing Videos

div.p: Sometimes the insane engineering projects the military industrial complex attempt actually work. Sometimes they don't. In between, there's testing and the testing videos that go along with it.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10fDKPy hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Samsung's Secret

div.p: An in-depth look at how Samsung managed to claw away at Apple's marketshare and become the number one smartphone maker.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-Zr2q6M hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Sorry, The World Will Still Be Obsessed With Lindsay Lohan For Some Time

div.p: Fifteen minutes of fame? More like 15 years. Once a celebrity claws their way to the top, they're unlikely to get knocked off the pedestal, a new study finds.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10TFoKy hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: U.S. Flies Stealth Bombers Over South Korea In A Show Of Force

div.p: The American military made a rare announcement that two nuclear-capable B-2 stealth bombers ran a practice bombing sortie over South Korea on Thursday, underscoring Washington’s commitment to defend its ally amid rising tensions with North Korea.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-102GaDA hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: ALMOST OUT OF THE UNCANNY VALLEY, ALMOST

h2.a: Activision Shows Off Stunning, Unsettling Next-Gen Facial Rendering

div.p: If you thought Sony's creepy tech demo involving that old man's face was something, wait until you see what Activision's R&D department has been working on.
